newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish industrial climate improves in April.
newsitem.headline: Polish industrial climate improves in April.

text.p: Poland's industrial climate in the manufacturing sector improved in April after a two-month fall as demand and output forecast became more opimistic, the Central Statistics Office (GUS) said on Thursday.

In its monthly survey GUS said the industrial climate index increased to 10 points in April from four points in March and seven points in February. Small and large companies were the most optimistic about future prospects, it said.
GUS said the construction sector climate index increased to 52 points in April from 45 points in February, mainly as a result of better future orders. @
The retail sector climate index fell by four points to one points in April, pulled down by pessimism of state-owned companies.
The indicator is a percentage balance between positive and negative responses from polled companies.
